annotations.html: In today's society, play is valued as a developmental pastime for children that is meant to be spontaneous, imaginative, and free of responsibility.
annotations.text: In today's society, play is valued as a developmental pastime for children that is meant to be spontaneous, imaginative, and free of responsibility.

(A) The people of ancient Greece held clear ideas about the character and ideals that a truly noble person should have, and the daily activities of life were intended to help citizens become such a person.

(B) The ancient Greeks, however, placed even more importance on the act of playing. They viewed it as a way to prepare children for fulfilling their social commitment to Greek society. It was also meant to develop their appreciation of the arts, such as music, poetry, and drama.

(C) Improving children's physical, mental, and social well-being through play was seen as an important step in this process. Nowadays, most societies aren't this demanding, but the influence of the Greeks can still be seen in modern views of recreation and leisure.

annotations.html:

② (B) - (A) - (C)
③ (B) - (C) - (A)
④ (C) - (A) - (B)
⑤ (C) - (B) - (A)

annotations.html: Thank you for being a customer of Simpson's Marketplace.
annotations.text: Thank you for being a customer of Simpson's Marketplace.

(A) We were sorry to hear that you thought the butter was too salty, but our strict policies prevent us from accepting any returns of perishable foods. As stated on your receipt, all sales of food products are nonrefundable.

(B) However, we consider you a valued customer, so we have included with this letter a coupon code for 20% off your next butter purchase. We hope that one of our low-salt butter varieties will be more to your liking. The code is usable on our website or at any of our stores
(C) We take customer concerns very seriously and appreciate your input. However, we could not accept the container of Ben's Baking Butter that you tried to return by mail earlier this week.

annotations.text: A caul, otherwise known as a veil, is a thin layer of cell membrane that attaches itself to a baby's skin, usually around the face.

(A) For instance, coal miners carried cauls with them while working underground, for they believed that the cauls would help them avoid danger. And in Rome, lawyers carried cauls, believing that they would help them in the courtroom.
(B) Other cultures believed that children who were born with a caul were lucky and couldn't drown. Therefore, sailors who carried cauls were thought to be protected from drowning at sea.

(C) Only one in every 80,000 children is born with a caul covering their face or head. Because this is such a rare occurrence, many cultures around the world developed superstitions and myths about it.

annotations.html: If technology companies had their way, most analog products would be obsolete and people would do almost everything on smart devices.
annotations.text: If technology companies had their way, most analog products would be obsolete and people would do almost everything on smart devices.

(A) We are emotional beings who also value the slower, hands-on experiences that analog products provide. We may consider ourselves to be living in a digital age, but the human experience is still largely an analog one.

(B) In many ways, this is already happening, but some analog products have made a comeback recently. For example, the sales of such items as paper notebooks and vinyl records have increased in the past ten years.

(C) Surprisingly, a lot of these sales are driven by millennials who aren't attached to these items by nostalgia. It may seem odd for them to choose analog products over more modern and efficient technology. But efficiency isn't always the primary goal for humans.

annotations.html: A 2005 study conducted by Dr. Glenn Wilson of the Institute of Psychiatry in London produced some interesting results.
annotations.text: A 2005 study conducted by Dr. Glenn Wilson of the Institute of Psychiatry in London produced some interesting results.

(A) There is no question that, when used appropriately, communication devices and services can boost productivity. However, when their use is not controlled, they may compromise workers' mental states and therefore also their performance.

(B) And the study confirmed that this kind of continual disruption in the workplace can drastically affect employees. The researchers even reported that workers were shown to suffer a temporary IQ drop of roughly 10 points when they were repeatedly interrupted by phone calls and emails.

(C) The study showed that office workers who habitually stopped what they were doing to respond to emails and texts were in a similar mental state to someone who had not slept the night before. Of the 1,100 study subjects, over half said they immediately responded to all emails.

annotations.html: 다음 중 흐름상 어색한 문장을 고르시오.

In today's society, play is valued as a developmental pastime for children that is meant to be spontaneous, imaginative, and free of responsibility. The ancient Greeks, however, placed even more importance on the act of playing. ① They viewed it as a way to prepare children for fulfilling their social commitment to Greek society. ② It was also meant to develop their appreciation of the arts, such as music, poetry, and drama. ③ The competitiveness gained through play led to jealousy of others. ④ The people of ancient Greece held clear ideas about the character and ideals that a truly noble person should have, and the daily activities of life were intended to help citizens become such a person. ⑤ Improving children's physical, mental, and social well-being through play was seen as an important step in this process. Nowadays, most societies aren't this demanding, but the influence of the Greeks can still be seen in modern views of recreation and leisure.
annotations.text: In today's society, play is valued as a developmental pastime for children that is meant to be spontaneous, imaginative, and free of responsibility. The ancient Greeks, however, placed even more importance on the act of playing. ① <u>They viewed it as a way to prepare children for fulfilling their social commitment to Greek society</u>. ② <u>It was also meant to develop their appreciation of the arts, such as music, poetry, and drama</u>. ③ <u>The competitiveness gained through play led to jealousy of others</u>. ④ <u>The people of ancient Greece held clear ideas about the character and ideals that a truly noble person should have, and the daily activities of life were intended to help citizens become such a person</u>. ⑤ <u>Improving children's physical, mental, and social well-being through play was seen as an important step in this process</u>. Nowadays, most societies aren't this demanding, but the influence of the Greeks can still be seen in modern views of recreation and leisure.

annotations.html: 다음 중 흐름상 어색한 문장을 고르시오.

Dear Mr. Dobson,
Thank you for being a customer of Simpson's Marketplace. We take customer concerns very seriously and appreciate your input. ① However, we could not accept the container of Ben's Baking Butter that you tried to return by mail earlier this week. ② We were sorry to hear that you thought the butter was too salty, but our strict policies prevent us from accepting any returns of perishable foods. ③ As stated on your receipt, all sales of food products are nonrefundable. ④ However, we consider you a valued customer, so we have included with this letter the refund and a coupon code for 20% off your next butter purchase. ⑤ And We hope that one of our low-salt butter varieties will be more to your liking. The code is usable on our website or at any of our stores. Thank you for your business.
Michelle Fisher
Customer Service Manager

annotations.html: 다음 중 흐름상 어색한 문장을 고르시오.

A caul, otherwise known as a veil, is a thin layer of cell membrane that attaches itself to a baby's skin, usually around the face. Only one in every 80,000 children is born with a caul covering their face or head. Because this is such a rare occurrence, many cultures around the world developed superstitions and myths about it. ① For instance, coal miners carried cauls with them while working underground, for they believed that the cauls would help them avoid danger. ② The natural resources that the miners dug at their peril were of great help to the development of society. ③ And in Rome, lawyers carried cauls, believing that they would help them in the courtroom. ④ Other cultures believed that children who were born with a caul were lucky and couldn't drown. ⑤ Therefore, sailors who carried cauls were thought to be protected from drowning at sea.
annotations.text: A caul, otherwise known as a veil, is a thin layer of cell membrane that attaches itself to a baby's skin, usually around the face. Only one in every 80,000 children is born with a caul covering their face or head. Because this is such a rare occurrence, many cultures around the world developed superstitions and myths about it. ① <u>For instance, coal miners carried cauls with them while working underground, for they believed that the cauls would help them avoid danger</u>. ② <u>The natural resources that the miners dug at their peril were of great help to the development of society</u>. ③ <u>And in Rome, lawyers carried cauls, believing that they would help them in the courtroom</u>. ④ <u>Other cultures believed that children who were born with a caul were lucky and couldn't drown</u>. ⑤ <u>Therefore, sailors who carried cauls were thought to be protected from drowning at sea</u>.

annotations.html: 다음 중 흐름상 어색한 문장을 고르시오.

If technology companies had their way, most analog products would be obsolete and people would do almost everything on smart devices. In many ways, this is already happening, but some analog products have made a comeback recently. For example, the sales of such items as paper notebooks and vinyl records have increased in the past ten years.
① Surprisingly, a lot of these sales are driven by millennials who aren't attached to these items by nostalgia. ② It may seem odd for them to choose analog products over more modern and efficient technology. ③ As such, analog products satisfy us not only the nostalgia of the past but also the efficiency. ④ But efficiency isn't always the primary goal for humans. ⑤ We are emotional beings who also value the slower, hands-on experiences that analog products provide. We may consider ourselves to be living in a digital age, but the human experience is still largely an analog one.
annotations.text:
If technology companies had their way, most analog products would be obsolete and people would do almost everything on smart devices. In many ways, this is already happening, but some analog products have made a comeback recently. For example, the sales of such items as paper notebooks and vinyl records have increased in the past ten years.
① <u>Surprisingly, a lot of these sales are driven by millennials who aren't attached to these items by nostalgia</u>. ② <u>It may seem odd for them to choose analog products over more modern and efficient technology</u>. ③ <u>As such, analog products satisfy us not only the nostalgia of the past but also the efficiency</u>. ④ <u>But efficiency isn't always the primary goal for humans</u>. ⑤ <u>We are emotional beings who also value the slower, hands-on experiences that analog products provide</u>. We may consider ourselves to be living in a digital age, but the human experience is still largely an analog one.

annotations.html: 다음 중 흐름상 어색한 문장을 고르시오.

A 2005 study conducted by Dr. Glenn Wilson of the Institute of Psychiatry in London produced some interesting results. ① The study showed that office workers who habitually stopped what they were doing to respond to emails and texts were in a similar mental state to someone who had not slept the night before. ② Of the 1,100 study subjects, over half said they immediately responded to all emails, and the study confirmed that this kind of continual disruption in the workplace can drastically affect employees. ③ The researchers even reported that workers were shown to suffer a temporary IQ drop of roughly 10 points when they were repeatedly interrupted by phone calls and emails. ④ So without communication devices and services, the workers will be able to work efficiently enough. ⑤ There is no question that, when used appropriately, communication devices and services can boost productivity. However, when their use is not controlled, they may compromise workers' mental states and therefore also their performance.

However, when their use is not controlled, they may compromise workers' mental states and therefore also their performance.

In today's society, play is valued as a developmental pastime for children that is meant to be spontaneous, imaginative, and free of responsibility. The ancient Greeks (a) [ however / likewise ], placed even more importance on the act of playing. They viewed it as a way to prepare children for fulfilling their social commitment to Greek society. It was also meant to develop their appreciation of the arts, such as music, poetry, and drama. The people of ancient Greece held clear ideas about the character and ideals that a truly noble person should have, and the daily activities of life were intended to help citizens become such a person. Improving children's physical, mental, and social well-being (b) [ through / throughout ] play was seen as an important step in this process. Nowadays, most societies aren't this demanding, but the influence of the Greeks can still be seen in modern views of recreation and leisure.

annotations.html: 다음 중 적절한 것을 선택하시오.

Dear Mr.Dobson,
Thank you for being a customer of Simpson's Marketplace. We take customer concerns very seriously and appreciate your input. (a) [ Accordingly / However ], we could not accept the container of Ben's Baking Butter that you tried to return by mail earlier this week. We were sorry to hear that you thought the butter was too salty, but our strict policies prevent us from accepting any returns of perishable foods. As stated on your receipt, all sales of food products are nonrefundable. (b) [ However / Therefore ], we consider you a valued customer, so we have included with this letter a coupon code for 20% off your next butter purchase. We hope that one of our low-salt butter varieties will be more to your liking. The code is usable on our website or at any of our stores. Thank you for your business.
Michelle Fisher
Customer Service Manager

(a) [ For example / In contrast ], the sales of such items as paper notebooks and vinyl records have increased in the past ten years. We are emotional beings who also value the slower, hands-on experiences that analog products provide. We may consider ourselves to be living in a digital age, but the human experience is still largely an analog one.

A 2005 study conducted by Dr. Glenn Wilson of the Institute of Psychiatry in London produced some interesting results. The study showed that office workers who habitually stopped what they were doing to respond to emails and texts were in a similar mental state to someone who had not slept the night (a) [ ago / before ]. Of the 1,100 study subjects, over half said they immediately responded to all emails, and the study confirmed that this kind of continual disruption in the workplace can drastically affect employees. The researchers even reported that workers were shown to suffer a temporary IQ drop of roughly 10 points when they were repeatedly interrupted by phone calls and emails. There is no question that, when used appropriately, communication devices and services can boost productivity, (b) [ However / Thus ], when their use is not controlled, they may compromise workers' mental states and therefore also their performance.

The study showed that office workers who habitually stopped what ① they were doing to respond to emails and texts were in a similar mental state to someone who had not slept the night before. annotations.text: In today's society, play is valued as a developmental pastime for children that is meant to be spontaneous, imaginative, and free of responsibility. The ancient Greeks, however, placed even more importance on the act of playing. They viewed it as a way <u>그리스 사회에 대한 그들의 사회적 책무를 이행하도록 아이들을 준비시킬 수 있는</u>. It was also meant to develop their appreciation of the arts, such as music, poetry, and drama. The people of ancient Greece held clear ideas about the character and ideals that a truly noble person should have, and the daily activities of life were intended to help citizens become such a person.

annotations.text: Thank you for being a customer of Simpson's Marketplace. We take customer concerns very seriously and appreciate your input. However, we could not accept the container of Ben's Baking Butter that you tried to return by mail earlier this week. We were sorry to hear that you thought the butter was too salty, but our strict policies <u>상하기 쉬운 음식의 어떠한 반환도 우리가 받아들이는 것을 막는다<u>. As stated on your receipt, all sales of food products are nonrefundable. However, we consider you a valued customer, so we have included with this letter a coupon code for 20% off your next butter purchase. We hope that one of our low-salt butter varieties will be more to your liking.

Only one in every 80,000 children is born <u>대망막이 그들의 얼굴 또는 머리를 덮은 채로</u>. Because this is such a rare occurrence, many cultures around the world developed superstitions and myths about it. If technology companies had their way, most analog products would be obsolete and people would do almost everything on smart devices. In many ways, this is already happening, but some analog products have made a comeback recently. For example, the sales of such items as paper notebooks and vinyl records have increased in the past ten years. Surprisingly, a lot of these sales are driven by millennials who aren't attached to these items by nostalgia. <u>그들이 아날로그 제품들을 선택하는 것이 이상하게 보일지도 모른다</u> over more modern and efficient technology. But efficiency isn't always the primary goal for humans. We are emotional beings who also value the slower, hands-on experiences that analog products provide. We may consider ourselves to be living in a digital age, but the human experience is still largely an analog one.
